item.name: Seax
item.description: The seax looks like a merge between a sword and dagger. There is a large single-edged blade with an organic hilt of wood and horn.

item.name: Stiletto
item.description: The stiletto is a dagger with a long slender blade and needle-like point. The weapon is used primarily as a stabbing weapon.

item.name: Pugio
item.description: The pugio is primarily a stabbing weapon. Pugios are generally concealed and used as assassination weapons or last-defense.

item.name: Poniard
item.description: The poniard is a lightweight thrusting knife with an acutely pointed blade and crossguard. The weapon is used primarily by high status citizens or lords.

item.name: Dirk
item.description: The dirk is used by officers or soldiers, especially naval.The dirk is a single-edged slender dagger with an ornate hilt and curved crossguard.

item.name: Dagger
item.description: A dagger is a fighting knife with a sharp point designed or capable of being used as a thrusting or stabbing weapon. Daggers are used predominately in close combat confrontations, and sometimes used as thrown weapons in rare situations.

item.name: Pickaxe
item.description: A pickaxe is a hand tool with a hard head attached perpendicular to the handle. The head is made of some form of metal with a handle of most commonly wood. The head has a spike hend with a sharp point and opposite side it has a wedge. The tool is used to chisel or pick rocks and wood, and occasionally used in close combat by farmers or barbarians.

item.name: Katara
item.description: A katara or katar is a type of push dagger that's commonly represented by it's H-shaped horizontal hand grip. The ceremonial katar can be used during worship or sacrifices. The blade is now commonly seen in deep dens of high assassins or shadow walkers. The triangle blade is usually emblazoned with the symbol of the den or assassins house.

item.name: Cestus
item.description: A cestus is an ancient battle glove with affixed spikes and studs for piercing hand-to-hand combat. The cestus is used by vastly experienced thugs and is an expensive weapon that is hard to find.

item.name: Shortbow
item.description: The shortbow is small and used to shoot short distances, usually against game and rarely during battle.

item.name: Longbow
item.description: A longbow is used to hunt longer distances and bigger game, as well as occasionally used in warfare when composite bows aren't available.

item.name: Composite Bow
item.description: Composite bows are made from horn, sinew and special wood types to make sure that they're very strong. Composite bows are the recommended type for warfare but are occasionally substituted for longbows because of they're steep price and low availability.

item.name: Shuriken
item.description: Shuriken are generally used as throwing weapons. They are generally called stars but are really two tied perpendicular spikes.

item.name: Darts
item.description: Throwing darts are long hand-held missiles with feather backs, similar to an arrow with weighted tips that are usually poisoned and used in assassination.

item.name: Tomahawk Axe
item.description: A throwing axe resembles a hatchet with a straight shaft. There is usually an opposing weight at the head haft to allow balancing the axe for throwing.

item.name: Kunai
item.description: Though resembling what might seem to be a knife, the kunai is used generally as a crowbar-esque tool for scaling buildings.

item.name: Javelin
item.description: Javelin are light and then spears that are weighted in the haft to allow ease of throwing during battle.

item.name: Spear
item.description: A spear is a long wooden with a metallic sharp point at the tip to help pierce an enemies armor. A spear is similar to a pike except a spears tip stars square and has a longer head.

item.name: Pike
item.description: A pike is similar to a spear except the head is a circular shape. Pikes are balanced to be used predominately as cavalry instead of spearman against cavalry. They are slightly lighter and smaller than a standard spear.

item.name: Doloire
item.description: A doloire is a polearm like a spear with a long thin blade much like a falchion at the tip. A doloires falchion looks much like a curved teardrop with sharp edges on both sides.

item.name: Ranseur
item.description: A ranseur is a polearm much like a Doloire except with a long blade that is rectangular until the tip where it forms into a triangle shape. At the hafted end the ranseur has spikes that can be used to dismount soldiers or pierce and cut ribcages of horses when spearmen stop cavalry units.

item.name: Spetum
item.description: A spetum is a very thin and extremely sharp doloire with weights on the haft to allow the spearman to have ease of combat with ground military units.

item.name: Hasta
item.description: A hasta is a spetum with blades on both ends. They are not used by pikeman or spearmen, but instead as standard military units in combat. Hasta can be terribly expensive depending on which metal is used to craft them because of the double heads and weighting that the blacksmith has to do to ensure they are combat-capable.

item.name: Tepoztopilli
item.description: A tepoztopilli is a polearm with a circular obsidian shard at the end with shard spikes surrounding it. Tepoztopilli is a tribal weapon found in various parts of the Sedian continent originating from the old world before the War of Souls.

item.name: Falcata
item.description: A falcata is a wide sabre used during sea warfare. Falcatas are terribly expensive and are a sign of prominance and power.

item.name: Gladius
item.description: A gladius is a straight and wide shortsword. The gladius is made completely of metal without a wooden hilt.

item.name: Crescent Blade
item.description: A crescent blade is an irregularly curved blade similar to a falchion with a blade the size of a longsword. They are rare weapons occasionally used by naval fleets.

item.name: Kopis
item.description: A kopis is an ancient mini hoop-curved sickle that was used before the war of souls before the age of man. Not a lot is known about the kopis except that pictures of the Ancients are seen holding them in many pictographs seen on walls of the old kingdom.

item.name: Shortsword
item.description: A shortsword is the most common weapon used in battle by soldiers. A shortsword is helpful in small cooridors and because of its common use is quite affordable.

item.name: Broadsword
item.description: A broadsword is slightly longer than a shortsword and almost twice as wide. Broadswords are found everywhere but originated from The Bleak.

item.name: Masakari
item.description: A masakari is similar to a large pick-axe except resembling more tribal weapons. Masakari usually have dangling feathers, and is wrapped by rabbit or other small game fur on the hilt because of it's common use as a tool and weapon.

item.name: Sappara
item.description: A sappara is an ancient thin c-curved center sabre that was once used by priests who would sacrifice to Dekkashraen and pagan gods to increase the yield of their crops or other religious reasons.

item.name: Khopesh
item.description: A khopesh is an ancient and extremely rare mini c-curved sickle that was used by the high priest of pre-war religions.

item.name: Longsword
item.description: A longsword is slightly wider and much longer than a shortsword and is used on the fields of battle where enemies are wearing heavy armor and shortswords won't have the strength to pierce armor. Longswords have extra damage primarily because of their size and weight. They usually have a standard crossguard hilt to prevent sliding blades from damaging hands.

item.name: Flamberge
item.description: A flamberge is a slightly larger longsword commonly called a claymore except with a flame-tongued blade.

item.name: Falchion
item.description: A falchion is a wide-bladed sabre. Falchions like falcatas are used predominately during naval warfare on boarding parties.

item.name: Claymore
item.description: A claymore is an extended longsword. They are incredibly heavy and difficult to weild by all but the strongest warrior.

item.name: Hatchet
item.description: A hatchet is a small axe used predominately in cutting small shrubbery and wood, but accasionally used during combat where an apt weapon isn't available.

item.name: Axe
item.description: An axe is used predominately to cut wood, but there are many war axes that are crafted especially for combat, where their weight is balanced to the hand so that swinging at enemies pushes momentum in a wider and more controlled arc.

item.name: Field Axe
item.description: A field axe is a specialized axe with a long haft used to chop down trees, and chop up wood.

item.name: Rapier
item.description: A rapier is a thin short blade. Rapiers are very common but tend to be a little expensive because of the craftsmanship required to develop a blade so thin, malleable and tempered so that it doesn't break during combat.

item.name: Scythe
item.description: A scythe is a long-handed sickle.

item.name: Chakrum
item.description: A chakrum is a metallic and circle-shaped boomerang. The art of using chakrum takes many years and requires incredible expertise.

item.name: Scimitar
item.description: A scimitar is similar to a falcata except much longer. A scimitar is also a naval weapon.

item.name: Cleaver
item.description: A cleaver is quite similar to a meat cleaver except with a metal haft and thicker blade for use during battle. The weapon is used by barbarians who dual weild the weapon.

item.name: Falx
item.description: A falx is half polearm and half single-edged sword. A falx is terribly expensive because it was used by royal guards during the Kingdom of Menes, before it's fall during the War of Souls.

item.name: Rhomphaia
item.description: A rhomphaia is a shorter falx, half polearm, and half single-edged sword. The rhomphaia is expensive because it's existence predates the fall of the Kingdom of Menes where it was used by the kingdoms sentries.

item.name: Bardiche
item.description: A bardich is the most common polearm used by soldiers in New Saellem. Bardiche has a thin circular bladed head on a long wooden haft. The weapon isn't meant for fighting against cavalry as much as it is used to fight atop walls and against shortswords by keeping distance from the intruder, or even pushing them off the walls during a siege.

item.name: Bill
item.description: A bill is a polearm similar to a bardiche except with a spade tip. It's used for pushing and slashing damage at a slightly ranged distance.

item.name: Glaive
item.description: A glaive is a specialized polearm that is built with blades and hooks at various parts of it's metallic head. It is applicable for fighting cavalry, raiding on foot, phalanx movement, and wall guarding.

item.name: Guisarme
item.description: A guisarme is a rare and extremely successful version of the glaive. There aren't very many made because the invention of this polearm was rather recent. It's currently only created and found within New Saellem.

item.name: Voulge
item.description: A voulge is a Doloire with a more triangular shape. The polearm is found only within New Saellem.

item.name: Staff
item.description: A staff is a very affordable long stick or metallic shaft used during combat. Occasionally the staff may have a head for magic users to help their concentration of will during spellcasting.

item.name: Morning Star
item.description: A morning star is a spiked mace used during close combat.

item.name: Macuahuiti
item.description: A macuahuiti is a wooden club with obsidian shards embedded in it.

item.name: Mace
item.description: A mace is a metallic club used in close combat.

item.name: Flail
item.description: A flail is a mace with 3 chained attached spiked balls. Flails are very dangerous weapons and hard to master.

item.name: Hammer
item.description: This hammer is not a tool, but a large pounding weapon used in combat to smash enemies. Hammers require a great deal of strength because the force of the weapon hitting the enemy determines the amount of damage, as there is no blade to pierce flash or armor.

item.name: War Hammer
item.description: A war hammer is a two-handed hafted hammer with two heads on one end. The weapon requires a great deal of strength.

item.name: Scepter
item.description: A scepter is a mace that is adorned with gilding and precious metal, minerals, and stone.

item.name: Club
item.description: A club is similar to a mace except it is much thicker and predominately made of wood.

item.name: Blackjack
item.description: A blackjack is predominately made of leather and is a thin club used to knockout opponents without killing them.

item.name: Eku
item.description: An eku is a boat paddle.

item.name: Sai
item.description: Sai is a three octogonal pronged one-handed bladeless shortsword that pierces, bashes, and slashes.

item.name: Halberd
item.description: A halberd is the most sophisticated polearm that can be used against any form of military unit with the proper training. There are a variety of spikes, hammers, and hooks at the head and sometimes at the foot of the haft to help the combatant during battle. The halberd can be expensive as the weapon isn't very common and can be difficult to make.

item.name: Trident
item.description: A trident is a long-hafted Sai, or three pronged weapon except instead of an octogonal haft, the haft is spherical and comes to very sharp points at the end. It is said to have once been used for sword-breaking. Others claim the weapon was used for fishing.

item.name: Kukri
item.description: A kukri is a machete dagger. Its form is used for slashing and piercing, and it requires extensive training to utilize completely and adequately.

item.name: Lathi
item.description: A lathi is an extremely long bamboo stick.

item.name: Whip
item.description: A whip is predominately made of leather, and is used to snap across distances upon enemies or animals. Sometimes the end of the whip is attached with shards of glasses, or metal flecks.
